body.p:
Maysville Feby 27th 1862
Hon B. Magoffin
Govenor of Ky
Dear Sir,

At the July Term 1861 of the Mason Circuit Court R. W. Nelson of this county was fined $200. for allowing gaming in his house. Mr Nelson assures us that he never allowed gaming in his house, but the young men of the neighborhood would occasionally congregate at his house & play for the drinks, but always without his knowledge or consent. It is a heavy fine and we think from the knowledge we have of Mr Nelson & the kind of house he keeps. that it is a case in which your Excellency should interpose as the costs &c will be an adequiate punishment. We therefore hope you will remit this fine, and
let Mr Nelson, off -- as he is a worthy gentleman & a good landlord & in an certain, would not willingly violate any law.

Most truly yours
R. H. Stanton
Thos J. Throop

Mason Cir. Ct
$200 } Gaming
R. W. Nelson
Issd Mar. 4 1862
